results.title: Capital Circle: Canberra
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Capital Circle was designed to disperse traffic flows and to protect the Parliamentary Triangle. This film is a record of the planning and construction of the inner and outer rings, viaducts, cuttings and road works around Capital Hill in Canberra, built to facilitate traffic flow between the Woden Valley and Canberra City.

results.title: Special Project no. 14: Marlo-Mallacoota-Cape Conran
results.brief_description: The Country Roads Board’s Project no. 14 involves the building of a road from Orbost to Marlo. Shows the first section to Cape Conran and difficulties encountered in clearing and leveling the sandy loam. The area opened by the road has great development potential in its attractive surf beaches, bushland and off-shore oil drilling. Photography by Jim Stirling.

results.title: Capacity Smith: the story of a successful dairy farmer
results.creator_credit: Colin Dean and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: This early venture into docu-drama remains one of the government unit’s most successful, made with wit and skilful use of editing and music. The unlikely subject of scientific farm management is dramatised (using post-synchronised dialogue characteristic of the time) through the story of young Smith. Against the wishes of his father, but with his mother’s support, young Smith is permitted to study at the Hawkesbury Agricultural College. Returning home, he demonstrates to a sceptical father some of the benefits of modern methods of farming. Photographed by Frank Bagnall.

results.title: Capacitors
results.creator_credit: John Durst, Frank A. Hoare and Merton Park
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Electrical Induction and Capacity”.
A brief summary of facts on electrostatics is followed by a demonstration of experiments with the Leyden jar; explanation of phenomenon in terms of build-up of charge; electroscope measurements when two charged plates are moved in relation to one another and when the dielectric is changed; capacitor or condensor factors affecting capacity; examples of capacitors at work.

results.title: Capability Brown
results.creator_credit: D.C. Chipperfield and Ransomes Film Unit
results.brief_description: The work of Lancelot Brown (1716-1793), the founder of the English style of landscape gardening, whose pioneering was, to a great extent, responsible for the very shape of the English countryside. Contrasts this with the formal French garden style, and looks at the great houses whose gardens were worked on by Brown - Longleat, Chatsworth House and Blenheim.

results.title: Canungra
results.creator_credit: Terry Ohlsson, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: The origins of Canungra go back to 1942 when army headquarters ordered the formation of a jungle warfare training centre. Today the roles of the Land Warfare Centre have expanded to include the training of personnel of all Corps in Tactics and Administration, for land warfare and the development of associated doctrine, and equipment and operational techniques. (Marketing film aimed at recruitment for the Australian Army)

results.title: Canon
results.creator_credit: Grant Munro, Norman McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In its simplest form the canon is a kind of singing game, a round for voices where each singer picks up the words and tune, a beat or so after the preceding one. Norman McLaren and Grant Munro demonstrate, by animation and live action, how a canon works. A child’s blocks are used in a checkerboard to illustrate the form of Frere Jacques. Two additional canons specially written for the film by Eldon Rathburn are acted out. Five awards, including Toronto.

results.title: Canine eyes for the blind
results.creator_credit: Hollywood Film Enterprises and Three Crown
results.brief_description: Deals with seeing-eye dogs, describing their use as guides for the blind, and how they are trained and selected. Points out that German Shepherd dogs usually make the best guide. Before training commences the dogs are checked for medical fitness and suitability and introduced to a normal domestic environment. They must undergo exacting tests with blindfolded instructors in city traffic; finally both dog and owner are taught to work together at the training centre.
results.description: Deals with seeing-eye dogs, describing their use as guides for the blind, and how they are trained and selected. Points out that German Shepherd dogs usually make the best guide. results.title: Cancer: a research story
results.creator_credit: Larry Schwab, American Cancer Society, Dephoure Studios and Teleprograms
results.brief_description: Illustrates the story of the American Cancer Society’s basic research in cancer. This seeks to discover the causes, cures and controls of the disease. The narration is by the former Medical and Scientific Director of the Society, Dr Charles S. Cameron.

results.title: Cancer: the smoker's gamble
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
What does all the research which has been carried out in Britain and America in recent years add up to? This enquiry undertakes a detailed study of the latest scientific evidence and assesses meaning. Three establishments pursuing different lines of controversial research, are visited.
